result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Tokarski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber if approved by jail administration an may serve 2nd half of days in jail, is eligible for Electronic Monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
  Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
10:55 a.m. TAPE RECORDED: Defendant Michael J Tokarski in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs with joint recommendation.   1 day credit.

BY THE COURT:********PROBATION***
Count 1:
I  / S  Sentence: 30 days jail w/huber 2nd half on EM if qualifies- stayed
12 mo probation:
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
  Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample.  
Pay costs and drug surcharge and DNA surcharge.
TAPE RECORD END: 11:13:56

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Michael J Tokarski in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin appearing on behalf of Elizabeth Constable.
3:24 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.

2:10 p.m. Defendant Michael J Tokarski in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Bond continued.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
